sections: If you were one of the lucky 3,300 people that race to the dealership to reserve your Dodge Demon in 2017, a top of the line example could be had for around $90k but today that same car is going to cost well over $100k.

, immediately breaking a multitude of production car records. It was the first ever production car to be built with the capabilities that it has and to use the technology that it does. The secret behind
is more than just an 840-horsepower supercharged engine.

a special engine programming system to allow the car to selectively run on high octane fuel for maximum power output, included the largest factory hood scoop to increase airflow, and designed the transmission to have a trans brake and torque reserve technology which has also never before been done. The result is the world’s fastest, hardest launching passenger car ever made. It is capable of a 0-60 sprint in just 2.3-seconds at 1.8 Gs of force and its 9.65 second ET at 140-mph led the NHRA to officially ban it from competition.
If you missed your chance to pick up one of these awesome cars new, you are not completely out of luck just yet. Stephen Becker Automotive group is offering a very rare optioned

With only 130 miles on the odometer, it is practically new and includes all of the documentation proving it is a real Demon and an unopened Demon crate. This is a rare opportunity to own one of only 74 Octane
ever made. Don’t miss out on this awesome second chance because there might not be another one like it.
